samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand. They began working on it in the early 1990s, with the first version released in 1995. R is an implementation of the S programming language combined with lexical scoping semantics inspired by Scheme. The language is now maintained by the R Core Team and has become widely used in statistical computing, data analysis, and research.

R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand. They began working on it in the early 1990s, with the first version released in 1995. R is an implementation of the S programming language combined with lexical scoping semantics inspired by Scheme. The language is now maintained by the R Core Team and has become widely used in statistical computing, data analysis, and research.

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first official stable release of R, though development of the language had begun in the early 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first official stable release of R, though development of the language had begun in the early 1990s by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.
